N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9000.2 - Applications for and the inspection and copying of records

State Regulations
(a) A request to inspect and/or copy records
of the corporation or any of its subsidiaries shall be made to the secretary of
the corporation at the main office of the authority, One World Financial

Center, New York, NY 10281. Such request shall be made in writing and shall
reasonably describe the record or records sought. Whenever possible, the person
requesting records should supply information regarding dates, file designations
or other information that may help to describe the records. (b) Records shall be made available for
inspection and/or copying during regular business hours at the location or
locations within the authority's facilities designated by the corporate
secretary. (c) Within five business
days after receipt of such request, the corporation shall: (1)
provide access to the records
sought; (2)
deny access to the
records sought, such denial to be in writing setting forth the reason therefor
and right to appeal; or
(3)
furnish
a written acknowledgment of receipt of the request and a statement of the
approximate date when the request will be granted or denied. (d) If the requested records cannot
be located the secretary shall certify that the authority is not the custodian, or that the records cannot be found after diligent search. (e) Upon request, the corporate secretary
shall certify to the correctness of any copy provided under this
